project.name: exp-player
project.description: The Experimenter player and associated components

exp-player.name: exp-player
exp-player.description: Reusable parts of experiments. Includes frame definitions, randomizers, and utilities.

frames.name: frames
frames.description:
Reusable frames that can be used as part of user-defined experiments. This is the main reference for researchers
  looking to build their own experiment definitions on the experimenter platform.

components.name: components
components.description: Reusable components for UI rendering and interactivity

mixins.name: mixins
mixins.description: Mixins that can be used to add functionality, eg to a specific frame

randomizers.name: randomizers
randomizers.description:
Reusable randomizers that can be used as part of user-defined experiments.
Randomizers allow researchers to specify how to select which frames or
sequences of frames to use as part of a particular session of a given
experiment, for instance in order to counterbalance stimuli used across
subjects, assign subjects randomly to different experimental conditions, or
implement a longitudinal design where the frames used in this study depend on
the frames used in the participant's last session.

services.name: services
services.description: Services used to share data or provide centralized functionality

ExpExitSurvey.name: ExpExitSurvey
ExpExitSurvey.description: This is the exit survey used by "Your baby the physicist". Use the updated frame {{#crossLink "ExpLookitExitSurvey"}}{{/crossLink}} instead.

ExpExitSurveyPilot.name: ExpExitSurveyPilot
ExpExitSurveyPilot.description: This is the exit survey used by the "Your baby the physicist" pilot. Use the updated frame {{#crossLink "ExpLookitExitSurvey"}}{{/crossLink}} instead.

ExpFrameBase.name: ExpFrameBase
ExpFrameBase.description:
This provides common base behavior required for any experiment frame. All experiment frames must extend this one.
This frame has no configuration options because all of its logic is internal, and is almost never directly used
   in an experiment. It exports no data. Sample experiment definition usage (provided for completeness):
  ```json
    "frames": {
       "my-sample-frame": {
         "kind": "exp-base-frame"
       }
    }
 ```
As a user you will almost never need to insert a component into a template directly- the platform should handle that
   by automatically inserting `exp-player` when your experiment starts.
 However, a sample template usage is provided below for completeness.
```handlebars
  {{
      component currentFrameTemplate
        frameIndex=frameIndex
        framePage=framePage
        updateFramePage=(action 'updateFramePage')
        frameConfig=currentFrameConfig
        frameContext=currentFrameContext
       session=session
        experiment=experiment
       next=(action 'next')
        previous=(action 'previous')
        saveHandler=(action 'saveFrame')
        skipone=(action 'skipone')
        sessionCompleted=(action 'sessionCompleted')
       extra=extra
    }}
 ```

ExpFrameBaseUnsafe.name: ExpFrameBaseUnsafe
ExpFrameBaseUnsafe.description:
A modified version of the base frame, specifically designed to allow "unsafe" saves and let the user
  advance even if data from this frame did not save

The primary use case for this component is experiments that need to move through a series of frames without leaving
fullscreen mode: if next is fired as a promise, it does not count as a user interaction event
 https://openscience.atlassian.net/browse/LEI-369?focusedCommentId=46133&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels%3Acomment-tabpanel#comment-46133

This frame has no configuration options because all of its logic is internal, and is almost never directly used
  in an experiment. It exports no data. Sample experiment definition usage (provided for completeness):
```json
"frames": {
      "my-sample-frame": {
        "kind": "exp-base-frame-unsafe"
      }
   }
```

ExpLookitDialoguePage.name: ExpLookitDialoguePage
ExpLookitDialoguePage.description:
Frame to implement a storybook page with dialogue spoken by characters.
First, characters appear and any main narration audio is played.
Next, the user can click on the characters to play additional audio
associated with each character image, or (for a choice trial) the user clicks
one of the images to select it as an answer. Once main narration audio has
been played and either a selection has been made (for a choice trial,
isChoiceFrame: true) or all
required character audio has been played (for a non-choice trial), the user
can proceed by pressing 'next'. (A trial with only main narration audio can
also simply auto-proceed when audio is finished.)

Recording is optional. If webcam recording is conducted (doRecording: true)
then audio does not start until recording does, to ensure the entire trial
is recorded.

The character images are specified in 'images', including an image source,
positioning on the screen, any animation at the start of the trial, any
associated audio, and whether that audio is required.

This frame extends ExpFrameBaseUnsafe because it is displayed fullscreen
and expected to be repeated.

The examples below show a few expected uses of this frame. In phase-2,
two characters are shown; the protagonist is already present, and speaker1
flies in from the left. Speaker1 has associated audio (dialogue). After
the narrative audio, the user can click on speaker1 to play the audio, and
will then be able to proceed.

phase-5 is a choice trial, where the user has to click on one of the two
images before proceeding.

```json
"frames":
       "phase-2": {
           "kind": "exp-lookit-dialogue-page",
           "id": "phase-2",
           "baseDir": "https://s3.amazonaws.com/lookitcontents/politeness/",
           "audioTypes": ["mp3", "ogg"],
           "backgroundImage": "order1_test1_background.png",
           "doRecording": false,
           "autoProceed": false,
           "parentTextBlock": {
               "title": "Parents!",
               "text": "some instructions",
               "emph": true
           },
           "images": [
               {
                   "id": "protagonist",
                   "src": "order1_test1_listener1.png",
                   "left": "40",
                   "bottom": "2",
                   "height": "60"
               },
               {
                   "id": "speaker1",
                   "text": "Click to hear what he said!",
                   "src": "order1_test1_speaker1.png",
                   "left": "20",
                   "bottom": "2",
                   "height": "60",
                   "animate": "flyleft",
                   "requireAudio": true,
                   "imageAudio": [
                       {
                           "stub": "polcon_example_2_2speaker1polite"
                       }
                   ]
               }
           ],
           "audioSources": [
               {
                   "audioId": "firstAudio",
                   "sources": [
                       {
                           "stub": "polcon_example_2_1intro"
                       }
                   ]
               }
           ]
       },
       "phase-5": {
           "kind": "exp-lookit-dialogue-page",
           "id": "phase-5",
           "baseDir": "https://s3.amazonaws.com/lookitcontents/politeness/",
           "audioTypes": ["mp3", "ogg"],
           "backgroundImage": "order1_test1_background.png",
           "doRecording": false,
           "autoProceed": false,
           "isChoiceFrame": true,
           "parentTextBlock": {
               "title": "Parents:",
               "text": "click on the character your child selects.",
               "emph": true
           },
           "images": [
               {
                   "id": "speaker1",
                   "src": "order1_test1_speaker1.png",
                   "left": "20",
                   "bottom": "2",
                   "height": "60"
               },
               {
                   "id": "speaker2",
                   "src": "order1_test1_speaker2.png",
                   "left": "60",
                   "bottom": "2",
                   "height": "60"
               }
           ],
           "audioSources": [
               {
                   "audioId": "firstAudio",
                   "sources": [
                       {
                           "stub": "polcon_example_5q1"
                       }
                   ]
               }
           ]
       }
}

```

ExpLookitMoodQuestionnaire.name: ExpLookitMoodQuestionnaire
ExpLookitMoodQuestionnaire.description:
A standard mood survey with questions about factors that might affect a
child's responses. Includes Likert-type ratings of the CHILD's position on
the following scales:
- Tired - Rested
- Sick - Healthy
- Fussy - Happy
- Calm - Active

and of the PARENT's position on:
- Tired - Energetic
- Overwhelmed - On top of things
- Upset - Happy

It also asks for a response in hours:minutes for:
- how long ago the child last woke up from sleep or a nap
- how long until he/she is due for another nap/sleep (if regular nap schedule)
- how long ago the child last ate/drank

and for what the child was doing just before this (free-response). Responses
to all questions are required to move on.

This frame can be used as a starting point/example for other custom survey frames, or development of a customizable survey frame.

```json
"frames": {
   "mood-survey": {
       "introText": "How are you two doing? We really want to know: we’re interested in how your child’s mood affects his or her looking preferences.",
       "id": "mood-survey",
       "kind": "exp-lookit-mood-questionnaire"
   }
}

```

ExpPhysicsPreviewExplanation.name: ExpPhysicsPreviewExplanation
ExpPhysicsPreviewExplanation.description: This is a frame for offering parents the option to preview videos for the "Your baby the physicist" study, with hardcoded text. Use {{#crossLink "ExpLookitPreviewExplanation"}}{{/crossLink}} (followed by {{#crossLink "ExpVideoPreview"}}{{/crossLink}}) instead.

ExpPlayer.name: ExpPlayer
ExpPlayer.description:
Experiment player: a component that renders a series of frames that define an experiment

Sample usage:
```handlebars
{{exp-player
  experiment=experiment
  session=session
  pastSessions=pastSessions
  saveHandler=(action 'saveSession')
  frameIndex=0
  fullScreenElementId='expContainer'}}
```

FullScreen.name: FullScreen
FullScreen.description: Allow components to specify fullscreen capabilities based on minimal configuration options

MediaReload.name: MediaReload
MediaReload.description:
Allow any media-containing frame to correctly reset.
Fix LEI-93, an issue where the second of two consecutive videos did not play correctly.

Due to an internal ember quirk/optimization, the component instance is not destroyed if two of the same thing are
 used in a row, which means the same video tag was being dynamically reassigned- something HTML does not normally
allow. The page needs to be manually told to load the correct new video.

See commentary here: http://stackoverflow.com/a/18454389/1422268

VideoRecordMixin.name: VideoRecordMixin
VideoRecordMixin.description: A mixin that can be used to add basic support for video recording to a particular experiment frame

VideoRecorderObject.name: VideoRecorderObject
VideoRecorderObject.description:
An instance of a video recorder tied to or used by one specific page. A given experiment may use more than one
  video recorder depending on the number of video capture frames.

videoRecorder.name: videoRecorder
videoRecorder.description:
A service designed to facilitate video recording by providing helper methods and managing multiple recorder objects
 Using a persistent service is intended to ensure we destroy recorder elements when the video is done uploading,
 rather than just when the user exits the frame

classitems.description:
The base class does not define any data to save to the server. It does, however, capture some basic event
  timing data. (such as when the user clicks the "next" button)

This section slightly breaks YUIDoc conventions- rather than being a literal guide to using the code, the
  "parameters" here are abstract descriptions of what data is captured.

Each frame that extends ExpFrameBase will send an array `eventTimings`
back to the server upon completion. This array is an ordered list (oldest
to newest) of every EVENT that happened during the frame. Each event is
represented as an object with at least the properties
`{'eventType': EVENTNAME, 'timestamp': TIMESTAMP}`. Frame-specific events
may define additional properties that are sent.
classitems.name: serializeContent

classitems.description:
Create the time event payload for a particular frame / event. This can be overridden to add fields to every
 event sent by a particular frame
classitems.name: makeTimeEvent

params.name: extra
params.description: An object with additional properties to be sent to the server

return.description: Event type, time, and any additional metadata provided

classitems.description: Move to next frame
classitems.name: nextFrame

classitems.description: Phase number (just included as a convenience & sent to server, to make handling collected data simpler)
classitems.name: nPhase

classitems.description: Trial number (just included as a convenience & sent to server, to make handling collected data simpler)
classitems.name: nTrial

classitems.description: URL of background image; will be stretched to width of page
classitems.name: backgroundImage

classitems.description:
Whether this is a frame where the user needs to click to
select one of the images before proceeding
classitems.name: isChoiceFrame

classitems.description:
Base directory for where to find stimuli. Any image src
values that are not full paths will be expanded by prefixing
with `baseDir` + `img/`. Any audio/video src values that give
a value for 'stub' rather than 'src' and 'type' will be
expanded out to
`baseDir/avtype/[stub].avtype`, where the potential avtypes
are given by audioTypes and videoTypes.

Note that baseDir SHOULD include a trailing slash
(e.g., `http://stimuli.org/myexperiment/`, not
`http://stimuli.org/myexperiment`)
classitems.name: baseDir

classitems.description:
List of audio types to expect for any audio specified just
with a string rather than with a list of src/type pairs.
If audioTypes is ['typeA', 'typeB'] and an audio source
is given as [{'stub': 'intro'}], the audio source will be
expanded out to

```json
                [
                       {
                           src: 'baseDir' + 'typeA/intro.typeA',
                           type: 'audio/typeA'
                       },
                       {
                           src: 'baseDir' + 'typeB/intro.typeB',
                           type: 'audio/typeB'
                       }
               ]
```
classitems.name: audioTypes

classitems.description:
Whether to do webcam recording (will wait for webcam
connection before starting audio if so)
classitems.name: doRecording

classitems.description:
Whether to proceed automatically after audio (and hide
replay/next buttons)
classitems.name: autoProceed

classitems.description:
Array of objects describing audio to play at the start of
this frame. Each element describes a separate audio segment.
classitems.name: audioSources

subprops.name: audioId
subprops.description:
unique string identifying this
     audio segment

subprops.name: sources
subprops.description:
Array of {src: 'url', type:
     'MIMEtype'} objects with audio sources for this segment.

Can also give a single element {stub: 'filename'}, which will
be expanded out to the appropriate array based on `baseDir`
and `audioTypes` values; see `audioTypes`.

subprops.name: highlights
subprops.description:
Array of {'range': [startT,
     endT], 'image': 'imageId'} objects, where the imageId
     values correspond to the ids given in images

classitems.description: Text block to display to parent.
classitems.name: parentTextBlock

subprops.name: title
subprops.description: title to display

subprops.name: text
subprops.description: paragraph of text

subprops.name: emph
subprops.description: whether to bold this paragraph

classitems.description: Array of images to display and information about their placement
classitems.name: images

subprops.name: id
subprops.description: unique ID for this image. This will be used to refer to the choice made by the user, if any.

subprops.name: src
subprops.description: URL of image source (can be full URL, or stub to append to baseDir; see `baseDir`)

subprops.name: left
subprops.description: left margin, as percentage of story area width

subprops.name: height
subprops.description: image height, as percentage of story area height

subprops.name: bottom
subprops.description: bottom margin, as percentage of story area height

subprops.name: animate
subprops.description: animation to use at start of trial on this image, if any. If not provided, image is shown throughout trial. Options are 'fadein', 'fadeout', 'flyleft' (fly from left), and 'flyright'.

subprops.name: text
subprops.description: text to display above image, e.g. 'Click to hear what he said!' If omitted, no text is shown.

subprops.name: imageAudio
subprops.description:
sources Array of {src: 'url',
type: 'MIMEtype'} objects with audio sources for audio to play when this image is clicked, if any. (Omit to not associate audio with this image.)

Can also give a single element {stub: 'filename'}, which will
be expanded out to the appropriate array based on `baseDir`
and `audioTypes` values; see `audioTypes`.

subprops.name: requireAudio
subprops.description: whether to require the user to click this image and complete the audio associated before proceeding to the next trial. (Incompatible with autoProceed.)

classitems.description: Parameters captured and sent to the server
classitems.name: serializeContent

params.name: context
params.description: True to use big fat triangle as context figure, or false to use small skinny triangle as context. [same as passed to this frame]

params.name: altOnLeft
params.description: Whether to put the shape+size alternating stream on the left (other stream alternates only in size) [same as passed to this frame]

params.name: videoID
params.description: The ID of any video recorded during this frame

params.name: hasBeenPaused
params.description: whether this trial was paused

return.description: The payload sent to the server

classitems.description: Just before stopping webcam video capture
classitems.name: stoppingCapture

classitems.description: Immediately before starting intro/announcement segment
classitems.name: startIntro

classitems.description: Start of EACH calibration segment
classitems.name: startCalibration

params.name: location
params.description: location of calibration ball, relative to child: 'left', 'right', or 'center'

classitems.description: Immediately before starting test trial segment
classitems.name: startTestTrial

classitems.description: When change to non-fullscreen is detected
classitems.name: leftFullscreen

classitems.description: When change to fullscreen is detected
classitems.name: enteredFullscreen

classitems.description: records EACH triangle presentation during test trial
classitems.name: videoStreamConnection

params.name: Lshape
params.description: shape of left triangle: 'skinny' or 'fat'

params.name: Rshape
params.description: shape of right triangle: 'skinny' or 'fat'

params.name: LX
params.description: Horizontal offset of left triangle from rectangle center, in units where rectangle width = 70; positive = to right

params.name: LY
params.description: Vertical offset of left triangle from rectangle center, in units where rectangle height = 100.8; positive = down

params.name: RX
params.description: Horizontal offset of right triangle from rectangle center, in units where screen width = 200 and rectangle width = 70; positive = to right

params.name: RY
params.description: Vertical offset of right triangle from rectangle center, in units where rectangle height = 100.8; positive = down

params.name: LRot
params.description: rotation of left triangle in degrees. 0 degrees has long side horizontal and 15 degree angle (skinny triangle) or 60 degree angle (fat triangle) on left.

params.name: RRot
params.description: rotation of right triangle in degrees. 0 degrees has long side horizontal and 15 degree angle (skinny triangle) or 60 degree angle (fat triangle) on left.

params.name: LFlip
params.description: whether left triangle is flipped (1 = no, -1 = yes)

params.name: RFlip
params.description: whether right triangle is flipped (1 = no, -1 = yes)

params.name: LSize
params.description: size of left triangle, relative to standard ('standard' sizes are set so that areas of skinny & fat triangles are equal), in terms of side length (e.g. for a rectangle, 2 would mean take a 1x3 rectangle and make it a 2x6 rectangle, quadrupling the area)

params.name: RSize
params.description: size of right triangle, relative to standard ('standard' sizes are set so that areas of skinny & fat triangles are equal), in terms of side length (e.g. for a rectangle, 2 would mean take a 1x3 rectangle and make it a 2x6 rectangle, quadrupling the area)

classitems.description: Records each time triangles are cleared from display

classitems.description: Parameters captured and sent to the server
classitems.name: serializeContent

params.name: rested
params.description: Rating for CHILD on tired - rested scale, '1' to '7' where '7' is rested

params.name: healthy
params.description: Rating for CHILD on sick - healthy scale, '1' to '7' where '7' is healthy

params.name: childHappy
params.description: Rating for CHILD on fussy - happy scale, '1' to '7' where '7' is happy

params.name: active
params.description: Rating for CHILD on calm - active scale, '1' to '7' where '7' is active

params.name: energetic
params.description: Rating for PARENT on tired - energetic scale, '1' to '7' where '7' is energetic

params.name: ontopofstuff
params.description: Rating for PARENT on overwhelmed - on top of stuff scale, '1' to '7' where '7' is on top of stuff

params.name: healthy
params.description: Rating for PARENT on upset - happy scale, '1' to '7' where '7' is happy

params.name: napWakeUp
params.description: how long since the child woke up from nap, HH:mm

params.name: usualNapSchedule
params.description: whether the child has a typical nap schedule: 'no', 'yes', or 'yes-overdue' if child is overdue for nap

params.name: nextNap
params.description: only valid if usualNapSchedule is 'yes';  how long until child is due to sleep again, HH:mm

params.name: lastEat
params.description: how long since the child ate/drank, HH:mm

params.name: doingBefore
params.description: what the child was doing before this (free response)

return.description: The payload sent to the server

classitems.description:
Whether to do calibration instead of a static image display.
If this is true, then provide calibrationLength,
calibrationAudioSources, and calibrationVideoSources as well.
classitems.name: isCalibrationFrame

classitems.description:
Base directory for where to find stimuli. Any image src
values that are not full paths will be expanded by prefixing
with `baseDir` + `img/`. Any audio/video src values that give
a value for 'stub' rather than 'src' and 'type' will be
expanded out to
`baseDir/avtype/[stub].avtype`, where the potential avtypes
are given by audioTypes and videoTypes.

Note that baseDir SHOULD include a trailing slash
(e.g., `http://stimuli.org/myexperiment/`, not
`http://stimuli.org/myexperiment`)
classitems.name: baseDir

classitems.description:
List of audio types to expect for any audio specified just
with a string rather than with a list of src/type pairs.
If audioTypes is ['typeA', 'typeB'] and an audio source
(e.g. introAudioSources) is given as [{'stub': 'intro'}],
then introAudioSources will be expanded out to

```json
                [
                       {
                           src: 'baseDir' + 'typeA/intro.typeA',
                           type: 'audio/typeA'
                       },
                       {
                           src: 'baseDir' + 'typeB/intro.typeB',
                           type: 'audio/typeB'
                       }
               ]
```
classitems.name: audioTypes

classitems.description:
List of video types to expect for any video specified just
with a string rather than with a list of src/type pairs.
If video is ['typeA', 'typeB'] and an video source
is given as {['stub': 'attn']}, then
the video source will be expanded out to

```json
                [
                       {
                           src: 'baseDir' + 'typeA/attn.typeA',
                           type: 'video/typeA'
                       },
                       {
                           src: 'baseDir' + 'typeB/attn.typeB',
                           type: 'video/typeB'
                       }
               ]
```
classitems.name: videoTypes

classitems.description:
Whether to allow user to pause the study during the test
segment and restart from intro; otherwise, user can pause but
this frame will end upon unpausing. Applies to pausing during
both image display and calibration segments. Pausing is
always allowed during the intro.
classitems.name: allowPausingDuringTest

classitems.description:
URL of image to show on left, if any. Can be a full URL or a
stub that will be appended to `baseDir` + `img/` (see
baseDir).
classitems.name: leftImage

classitems.description:
URL of image to show on right, if any. Can be a full URL or a
stub that will be appended to `baseDir` + `img/` (see
baseDir).
classitems.name: right

classitems.description:
URL of image to show at center, if any. Can be a full URL or
a stub that will be appended to `baseDir` + `img/` (see
baseDir).
classitems.name: centerImage

classitems.description:
minimum amount of time to show attention-getter in seconds.
attention-getter intro video will be shown for at least this
long, and also until any intro audio finishes playing and a
webcam connection is established.
classitems.name: attnLength

classitems.description:
length of preferential looking trial in seconds. (Only used
if not isCalibrationFrame.)
classitems.name: trialLength

classitems.description:
length of single calibration segment in seconds (only used
if isCalibrationFrame)
classitems.name: calibrationLength

classitems.description:
Sources Array of {src: 'url', type: 'MIMEtype'} objects
for audio played during test trial. (Only used if not
isCalibrationFrame.)

Can also give a single element {stub: 'filename'}, which will
be expanded out to the appropriate array based on `baseDir`
and `audioTypes` values; see `audioTypes`.
classitems.name: testAudioSources

classitems.description:
Sources Array of {src: 'url', type: 'MIMEtype'} objects
for instructions or any other audio during attention-getter
video

Can also give a single element {stub: 'filename'}, which will
be expanded out to the appropriate array based on `baseDir`
and `audioTypes` values; see `audioTypes`.
classitems.name: introAudioSources

classitems.description:
Sources Array of {src: 'url', type: 'MIMEtype'} objects
for audio played after trial ends (optional, intended for
use on last trial to let parents know they can open their
eyes)

Can also give a single element {stub: 'filename'}, which will
be expanded out to the appropriate array based on `baseDir`
and `audioTypes` values; see `audioTypes`.
classitems.name: endAudioSources

classitems.description:
Sources Array of {src: 'url', type: 'MIMEtype'} objects
for calibration audio, played from start during each
calibration segment (only used if isCalibrationFrame)

Can also give a single element {stub: 'filename'}, which will
be expanded out to the appropriate array based on `baseDir`
and `audioTypes` values; see `audioTypes`.
classitems.name: calibrationAudioSources

classitems.description:
Sources Array of {src: 'url', type: 'MIMEtype'} objects
for calibration video, played from start during each
calibration segment (only used if isCalibrationFrame)

Can also give a single element {stub: 'filename'}, which will
be expanded out to the appropriate array based on `baseDir`
and `videoTypes` values; see `videoTypes`.
classitems.name: calibrationVideoSources

classitems.description:
Sources Array of {src: 'url', type: 'MIMEtype'} objects
for attention-getter video

Can also give a single element {stub: 'filename'}, which will
be expanded out to the appropriate array based on `baseDir`
and `videoTypes` values; see `videoTypes`.
classitems.name: videoSources

classitems.description:
Sources Array of {src: 'url', type: 'MIMEtype'} objects for
audio played upon pausing study

Can also give a single element {stub: 'filename'}, which will
be expanded out to the appropriate array based on `baseDir`
and `audioTypes` values; see `audioTypes`.
classitems.name: pauseAudio

classitems.description:
Sources Array of {src: 'url', type: 'MIMEtype'} objects for
audio played upon resuming study

Can also give a single element {stub: 'filename'}, which will
be expanded out to the appropriate array based on `baseDir`
and `audioTypes` values; see `audioTypes`.
classitems.name: unpauseAudio

classitems.description:
Sources Array of {src: 'url', type: 'MIMEtype'} objects for
audio played when study is paused due to not being fullscreen

Can also give a single element {stub: 'filename'}, which will
be expanded out to the appropriate array based on `baseDir`
and `audioTypes` values; see `audioTypes`.
classitems.name: fsAudio

classitems.description: Parameters captured and sent to the server
classitems.name: serializeContent

params.name: videoID
params.description: The ID of any video recorded during this frame

params.name: hasBeenPaused
params.description: whether this trial was paused

params.name: isCalibrationFrame
params.description: whether this is a calibration frame (given as a property of the frame)

params.name: allowPausingDuringTest
params.description: whether the user can return to the test/calibration period after pausing (given as a property of the frame)

params.name: rightImage
params.description: URL of image shown on right (given as a property of the frame)

params.name: leftImage
params.description: URL of image shown on left (given as a property of the frame)

params.name: centerImage
params.description: URL of image shown at center (given as a property of the frame)

params.name: trialLength
params.description: seconds to display images if this is a test trial (given as a property of the frame)

params.name: calibrationLength
params.description: s to display calibration video in each of four locations if this is a calibration trial (given as a property of the frame)

params.name: testAudioSources
params.description: Array of {src: 'url', type: 'MIMEtype'} objects for audio played during test trial (given as a property of the frame)

return.description: The payload sent to the server

classitems.description:
Base directory for where to find stimuli. Any image src
values that are not full paths will be expanded by prefixing
with `baseDir` + `img/`. Any audio/video src values that give
a value for 'stub' rather than 'src' and 'type' will be
expanded out to
`baseDir/avtype/[stub].avtype`, where the potential avtypes
are given by audioTypes and videoTypes.

Note that baseDir SHOULD include a trailing slash
(e.g., `http://stimuli.org/myexperiment/`, not
`http://stimuli.org/myexperiment`)
classitems.name: baseDir

classitems.description:
List of audio types to expect for any audio specified just
with a string rather than with a list of src/type pairs.
If audioTypes is ['typeA', 'typeB'] and an audio source
is given as [{'stub': 'intro'}], the audio source will be
expanded out to

```json
                [
                       {
                           src: 'baseDir' + 'typeA/intro.typeA',
```

and `audioTypes` values; see `audioTypes`.

Array of objects specifying video src and type for test video (these should be the same video, but multiple sources--e.g. mp4 and webm--are generally needed for cross-browser support). Example value:

```[{'src': 'http://.../video1.mp4', 'type': 'video/mp4'}, {'src': 'http://.../video1.webm', 'type': 'video/webm'}]```

List of objects specifying intro announcement src and type.
Example: `[{'src': 'http://.../audio1.mp3', 'type': 'audio/mp3'}, {'src': 'http://.../audio1.ogg', 'type': 'audio/ogg'}]`
classitems.name: audioSources

classitems.description: List of objects specifying music audio src and type, as for audioSources.
classitems.name: audioSources

classitems.description: Whether this is the last exp-physics-video frame in the group, before moving to a different frame type. (If so, play only the intro audio, no actual tests.)

classitems.description:
The recorder object. It is the responsibility of the consuming frame to set up the recorder when appropriate,
  and to set this property. If present, the mixin will automatically use it for things such as capturing stream
  time.
classitems.name: recorder

classitems.description: This mixin automatically injects the video recorder service, making its methods available to your frame
classitems.name: videoRecorder

classitems.description:
A video ID to use for this recording. Defaults to the format `<experimentId>_<frameId>_<sessionId>_`

There may be additional prefixes/suffixes added elsewhere in the video recording process. A final video
captured via this mixin might this have a name like:
  `videoStream_123mcGee_4-phys_eieio5_utctimestamp_random999.flv`
classitems.name: videoId

classitems.description: Extend any base time event capture with information about the recorded video
classitems.name: makeTimeEvent

classitems.description: Set up a video recorder instance
classitems.name: setupRecorder

params.name: element
params.description: A DOM node representing where to mount the recorder

params.name: record
params.description: Whether to start the recording immediately

params.name: settings
params.description: Config to pass to the newly created VideoRecorder

return.description: A promise representing the result of installing the recorder

classitems.description: Pause the recorder (and capture timing events)
classitems.name: pauseRecorder

params.name: skipIfMissing
params.description: If provided (and true), don't raise an error if recording isn't ready yet.

classitems.description: Resume a paused recording
classitems.name: resumeRecorder

throws.description: an exception if recorder fails to resume TODO: Based on existing usage anyway

classitems.description: Start recording
classitems.name: startRecorder

return.description: Promise Resolves when recording has started

classitems.description: Stop the recording
classitems.name: stopRecorder

return.description: Promise A promise that resolves when upload is complete

classitems.description: Object describing possible values for counterbalancing conditions.
classitems.name: counterbalance

subprops.name: startPositions
subprops.description:
list of starting positions
     for the triangle stream which alternates in both size and shape.
     (array of strings; options are 'left' and 'right')

subprops.name: contextOptions
subprops.description:
list of context triangle options
     (array of strings; options for context are 'fat', 'skinny')

classitems.description: Type of frame to use, e.g. 'exp-lookit-geometry-alternation'
classitems.name: frameType

classitems.description:
Object describing common parameters to use in EVERY frame created
by this randomizer. Parameter names and values are as described in
the documentation for the frameType used; see example above.
classitems.name: frameOptions

classitems.description: Select the first matching session from an array of options, according to the specified rules
classitems.name: getLastSession

params.name: pastSessions
params.description: An array of session records. This returns the first match, eg assumes newest-first sort order

return.description: The model representing the last session in which the user participated

classitems.description: Select the first matching session from an array of options, according to the specified rules
classitems.name: getLastSession

params.name: pastSessions
params.description: An array of session records. This returns the first match, eg assumes newest-first sort order

return.description: The model representing the last session in which the user participated

classitems.description:
Object describing common parameters to use in EVERY frame created
by this randomizer. Parameter names and values are as described in
the documentation for the frameType used.
classitems.name: commonFrameProperties

classitems.description: Unique string identifying this set of frames
classitems.name: id

classitems.description:
List of frames to be created by this randomizer. Each frame is an
object with any necessary frame-specific properties specified. The
'kind' of frame can be specified either here (per frame) or in
commonFrameProperties. If a property is defined for a given frame both
in this frame list and in commonFrameProperties, the value in the frame
list will take precedence.

(E.g., you could include 'kind': 'normal-frame' in
commmonFrameProperties, but for a single frame in frameList, include
'kind': 'special-frame'.)

Any property VALUES within any of the frames in this list which match
a property NAME in the selected parameterSet will be replaced by the
corresponding parameterSet value. E.g., suppose a frame in frameList is

```
  {'leftImage': 'LEFTIMAGE1',
  'rightImage': 'frog.jpg',
  'size': 'IMAGESIZE'}
```

and the row that has been selected randomly of parameterSets is

```
{'LEFTIMAGE1': 'toad.jpg',
       'LEFTIMAGE2': 'dog.jpg',
       'IMAGESIZE': 250}
```

Then the frame would be transformed into:
```
  {'leftImage': 'toad.jpg',
  'rightImage': 'frog.jpg',
  'size': 250}
```

The same values may be applied across multiple frames. For instance,
suppose frameList is

```
      [
           {
               'leftImage': 'LEFTIMAGE1',
               'rightImage': 'frog.jpg',
               'size': 'IMAGESIZE'
           },
           {
               'leftImage': 'LEFTIMAGE2',
               'rightImage': 'frog.jpg',
               'size': 'IMAGESIZE'
           }
       ]
```

Then the corresponding processed frames would include the values
```
      [
           {
               'leftImage': 'toad.jpg',
               'rightImage': 'frog.jpg',
               'size': 250
           },
           {
               'leftImage': 'dog.jpg',
               'rightImage': 'frog.jpg',
               'size': 250
           }
       ]
```
A property value like 'IMAGESIZE' may be placed in a frame definition
nested within another object (at any depth) or within a list and
will still be replaced.
classitems.name: frameList

classitems.description:
Array of parameter sets to randomly select from in order to determine
the parameters for each frame in this session.

A single element of parameterSets will be applied to a given session.
classitems.name: parameterSets

classitems.description:
[Optional] Array of weights for parameter sets; elements correspond to
elements of parameterSets. The probability of selecting an element
parameterSets[i] is parameterSetWeights[i]/sum(parameterSetWeights).

If not provided, all parameterSets are weighted equally.

This is intended to allow manual control of counterbalancing during
data collection, e.g. to allow one condition to "catch up" if it was
randomly selected less often.
classitems.name: parameterSetWeights

classitems.description: Install a recorder onto the page and optionally begin recording immediately.
classitems.name: install

return.description: Indicate whether widget was successfully installed and started

classitems.description: Start recording a video, and allow the state of the recording to be accessed for later usage
classitems.name: record

classitems.description:
Pause the recorder. If optional skipIfMissing argument is provided (and
  true), don't raise an error if recording isn't ready yet.
classitems.name: pause

classitems.description: Resume the recording
classitems.name: resume

classitems.description:
Get a timestamp based on the current recording position. Useful to ensure that tracked timing events
 line up with the video.
classitems.name: getTime

classitems.description: Stop recording and save the video to the server
classitems.name: stop

classitems.description:
Hide the recorder from display. Useful if you would like to keep recording without extra UI elements to
  distract the user.
classitems.name: hide

classitems.description:
Show the recorder to the user. Useful if you want to temporarily show a hidden recorder- eg to let the user fix
  a problem with video capture settings
classitems.name: show

classitems.description: Uninstall the video recorder from the page
classitems.name: destroy
